column2: He had a wife and one little girl, and after a long time his wife had another child.
column3: He had a wife and one little girl, and after a long time his wife had another child.

column2: In the course of time Janni's parents died, and he and his sister were left alone in the world; soon affairs went badly with them, so they determined to wander away to seek their fortune.
column3: In the course of time Janni's parents died, and he and his sister were left alone in the world; soon affairs went badly with them, so they determined to wander away to seek their fortune.

column2: In packing up, the sister found a knife which the monk had left for his godson, and this she gave to her brother.
column3: In packing up, the sister found a knife which the monk had left for his godson, and this she gave to her brother.

column2: After wandering for three days they met a man with three dogs who proposed that they should exchange animals, he taking the sheep, and they the dogs.
column3: After wandering for three days they met a man with three dogs who proposed that they should exchange animals, he taking the sheep, and they the dogs.

column2: The brother and sister were quite pleased at this arrangement, and after the exchange was made they separated, and went their different ways.
column3: The brother and sister were quite pleased at this arrangement, and after the exchange was made they separated, and went their different ways.

column2: So Janni found the castle deserted, and abode there with his sister, and every day went out to hunt with the weapons the Draken had left in the castle.
column3: So Janni found the castle deserted, and abode there with his sister, and every day went out to hunt with the weapons the Draken had left in the castle.

column2: One day, when he was away hunting, one of the Draken came up to get provisions, not knowing that there was anyone in the castle.
column3: One day, when he was away hunting, one of the Draken came up to get provisions, not knowing that there was anyone in the castle.

column2: But he plucked the cherries, and took them back to his sister.
column3: But he plucked the cherries, and took them back to his sister.

column2: And the sister ate the cherries and declared herself well again.
column3: And the sister ate the cherries and declared herself well again.

column2: But he took the quinces and brought them back to his sister, who, when she had eaten them, declared herself better.
column3: But he took the quinces and brought them back to his sister, who, when she had eaten them, declared herself better.

column2: The sister did as she was told, and next day Janni, taking his three dogs with him, went to get the pears.
column3: The sister did as she was told, and next day Janni, taking his three dogs with him, went to get the pears.

column2: So Janni plucked the pears and took them to his sister, who, when she had eaten them, declared she felt better.
column3: So Janni plucked the pears and took them to his sister, who, when she had eaten them, declared she felt better.

column2: The travellers let a rope down and drew him up to daylight.
column3: The travellers let a rope down and drew him up to daylight.

column2: When she learnt what had befallen him she called together all the sorceresses in the country in order that they should tell her where the eyes were.
column3: When she learnt what had befallen him she called together all the sorceresses in the country in order that they should tell her where the eyes were.
